p: 6. Such tools show two elements of themselves. These three ways that a tool can “stand out” as unusable reveal (1) an element of objective presence, but (2) in something useful I don’t notice that by way of detached observation, nor does the tool show up as “just a thing.” Instead, the objective presence shows up in conjunction with the usefulness of the tool. I do want to get the fridge out of the way--but it’s still something useful that I want to get out of the way.
